posts.com:
Been playing Radiant Historia lately so desertification from mana overconsumption is the first thing that comes to mind as a plot device. Your world could make willpower and self-discipline a magical force that binds the people to the land and vice versa. The sicker the cunts in any area, the more powerful the magic and the more fertile the land (which in turn produces more quality food for sick cunts to eat big to get big cmon).
Building off of that, make a slowly desertifying landmass of coping fatties/sjws, bickering over the arable land, blaming the /fit/ continent for their problems, and using subterfuge and treachery to sabotage fitizens' willpower.

>>55743877
black metal neanderthal tribes following caribou around a northern european environment, relying on muscleshamans to sacrifice gains via fasting and cardio to hallucinate the locations of megafauna or incoming threats ie hungry sabretooths or other tribes
Neanderthals except the males are hypermuscular and the women are hypercurvy normal looking modern humans. It's historically accurate that they would tackle deer and caribou with a knife, the bone break patterns in adult male neanderthal skeletons are closest to a modern rodeo rider.
Some young /fit/izen starts training with an aged master, who through some critical error was rendered useless by a famous megafauna out there somewhere. The master trains him in the ways of the wild hunt and fight, some friendly shaman blesses our main character, and he sets off with a loyal troop to catch the megadeer or giant cave bear or something.
build from there.

posts.com:
sounds like you're trying too hard to make le epic may may instead of an actual interesting world based on /fit/
Lets start at the foundations.

Here are some categories and subcategories you could work through:

Pride, Getting stronger to be better than your peers:
-Aesthetics
-Competition, requires others in order to have purpose
-Smashing puss, men and women are objects to have sex with
-obsession with numbers (you're one rep max) and lookism
-Fear of rejection

Self Improvement, Getting stronger to be better than yourself:
-self-centered, isolationists
-Focus on mental well-being
-"Look how far we've come"
-obsession with ideals, finding wisdom
-fear of lack of progress or falling behind

We're all gonna make it, helping yourself and others get stronger
-seeks to improve others
-community based
-fighting a common enemy
-variations of Self Improvement and Pride with similar shortcomings
-brotherhood and sisterhood
-protect the "innocent"
-obsession with family (biological and otherwise)
-fear of failure

each of these could be split into 3 to 6 distinct cultures
